result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Sentencing Hearing held on Nov. 28, 2016 before Honorable LaMont K. Jacobson

from bond poster to Judge requesting bond money returned - APPROVED

Clerk Marisa. 
Case Called: 1:38 pm 
INCLUDES 14CF97 AND 15CF1029. 
State appears by ADA Chad Minder; Deft appears in person with Atty Amanda Ley. 
Parties have received copies of PSI. 
No additions/corrections by the State. 
Atty Ley notes address correction to PSI. 
VRCW. 
Argument. 
Deft makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 

COURT ORDERS: 
In 14CF97: Ct. 1>>4 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 3 years ES. 
                  : Ct. 2>>4 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 3 years ES - CONCURRENT to Cts. 5, and 11 and CONSECUTIVE TO Ct. 1 - imposed and STAY for 3 years probation. 
                  : Ct. 5>>4 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 3 years ES - CONCURRENT to Cts. 2, and 11 and CONSECUTIVE TO Ct. 1 - imposed and STAY for 3 years probation
                  : Ct. 7>>SWH for 2 years probation - CONSECUTIVE TO Ct. 1. 
                  : Ct. 11>>4 years imprisonment - 1 year IC and 3 years ES - CONCURRENT to Cts. 2, and 5 and CONSECUTIVE TO Ct. 1 - imposed and STAY for 3 years probation

COURT ORDERS as CONDITIONS of probation/ES: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; maintain absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with prior agent authorization; maintain fulltime employment/school/combination of the 2 of at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 9 hours CS per week; pay restitution of $1198.48 to Cloverbelt Credit Union (joint and several with co-deft); absolutely no contact with co-deft L.V. or victims; DNA sample and surcharge; CC. 

COURT finds the deft eligible for CIP and SAP. 
COURT finds the deft entitled to 2 days sentence credit. 
COURT ORDERS cash bond returned to surety. 
COURT allows counsel to retain copies of PSI and reminds them to maintain their confidentiality. 
Atty Ley requests alternate PSI be sealed. 
COURT grants request - alternate PSI to be sealed. 
COURT authorizes 25% of prison funds be applied towards restitution. 
COURT remands def into custody for transport to WSPS. 

Adj: 2:30 pm
